page.title: 03HOUSING
page.content: Essex county council have given their thumbs down on the new plans to build a 5000-unit housing estate on protected greenbelt land at Bulphan.This decision occured at a council meeting on friday july 5th. A group of builders wanted to spend Â£300,000000 or more on the project.Leader of the local opposition campaign Mr Keith Derry said "I am pleased that the plan has been defeated, greenbelt land must be protected.If this plan had succeeded then this could have been the start of the erosion of greenbelt land in the UK. This decision hopefully means that housing development will in future take place in the West Thurrock area where most people think it is most needed.
